Package conflux.web3j

Class AccountManager

java.lang.Object
conflux.web3j.AccountManager
public class AccountManager
extends java.lang.Object
AccountManager manages Conflux accounts at local file system.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    AccountManager()
    Create a AccountManager instance with default directory.
    AccountManager​(java.lang.String dir)
    Create a AccountManager instance with specified directory.

    Check whether the specified account address is managed.

      Create a AccountManager instance with default directory.
      Throws:

      java.lang.Exception

      public AccountManager​(java.lang.String dir) throws java.lang.Exception
      Create a AccountManager instance with specified directory.
      Parameters:
      dir - directory to store key files.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if failed to create directories.
      java.lang.Exception

    • getDirectory

      public java.lang.String getDirectory()
      Get the directory to store key files.

    • getDefaultDirectory

      public static java.lang.String getDefaultDirectory()
      Get the default directory to store key files.
      Returns:
      directory path.

    • create

      public java.lang.String create​(java.lang.String password) throws java.lang.Exception
      Create a new account with specified password.
      Parameters:
      password - used to encrypt the key file.
      Returns:
      address of new created account.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • list

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> list() throws java.io.IOException
      List all managed accounts.
      Returns:
      list of addresses of all managed accounts.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • imports

      public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> imports​(java.lang.String keyFile, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String newPassword) throws java.lang.Exception
      Import unmanaged account from external key file.
      Parameters:
      keyFile - key file path.
      password - decrypt the external key file.
      newPassword - encrypt the new created/managed key file.
      Returns:
      imported account address if not exists. Otherwise, return Optional.empty().
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • imports

      public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> imports​(java.lang.String privateKey, java.lang.String password) throws java.lang.Exception
      Import unmanaged account from a private key.
      Parameters:
      privateKey - private key to import.
      password - encrypt the new created/managed key file.
      Returns:
      imported account address if not exists. Otherwise, return Optional.empty().
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • exists

      public boolean exists​(java.lang.String address) throws java.io.IOException
      Check whether the specified account address is managed.
      Parameters:
      address - account address.
      Returns:
      true if the specified account address is managed. Otherwise, false.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • delete

      public boolean delete​(java.lang.String address) throws java.io.IOException
      Delete the key file of specified account from key store. It will also clear the record if the specified account is unlocked.
      Parameters:
      address - account address to delete.
      Returns:
      false if the specified account not found. Otherwise, true.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • update

      public boolean update​(java.lang.String address, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String newPassword) throws java.lang.Exception
      Update the password of key file for the specified account address.
      Parameters:
      address - account address to update key file.
      password - password to decrypt the original key file.
      newPassword - password to encrypt the new key file.
      Returns:
      false if the specified account not found. Otherwise, true.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • unlock

      public boolean unlock​(java.lang.String address, java.lang.String password, java.time.Duration... timeout) throws java.lang.Exception
      Unlock the specified account for a period to allow signing multiple transactions at a time.
      Parameters:
      address - account address to unlock.
      password - decrypt the key file.
      timeout - a period of time to unlock the account. Empty timeout indicates unlock the account indefinitely.
      Returns:
      false if the specified account not found. Otherwise, true.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • lock

      public boolean lock​(java.lang.String address)
      Lock the specified account.
      Parameters:
      address - account address to lock.
      Returns:
      true if the specified account has already been unlocked and not expired. Otherwise, false.

    • signTransaction

      public java.lang.String signTransaction​(RawTransaction tx, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String... password) throws java.lang.Exception
      Sign a raw transaction with specified account.
      Parameters:
      tx - transaction to sign with.
      address - account address to sign the transaction.
      password - decrypt the key file. If empty, the account should be unlocked already.
      Returns:
      signed and RLP encoded transaction.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if account not found, or password not specified for locked account, or password expired for unlocked account.
      java.lang.Exception

    • signMessage

      public java.lang.String signMessage​(byte[] message, boolean needToHash, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String... password) throws java.lang.Exception
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • signMessage

      public static java.lang.String signMessage​(byte[] message, boolean needToHash, org.web3j.crypto.ECKeyPair ecKeyPair)
